title: A Scandal About Sharing Secrets
summary: Gordon Brown, a former Prime Minister, talked about a serious problem involving Peter Mandelson. Mandelson was a government official who shared secret information with a bad person named Jeffrey Epstein. This information was about the UK's economy and money plans, which could have hurt the country. Brown said that Keir Starmer, a leader, was too slow to fix things but is a good person who wants to do what's right. He believes Starmer can clean up the system. The police searched homes linked to Mandelson, but Mandelson says he did nothing wrong. Brown feels sad and angry because Mandelson betrayed his country by leaking secrets.

background_read: This article is about a political scandal in the UK. Gordon Brown, who was Prime Minister before, is giving his opinion on a situation where Peter Mandelson, a former government official, shared private information with Jeffrey Epstein, a person who did bad things. This could have hurt the UK's money and safety. Brown thinks Keir Starmer, a current leader, is honest but needs to act faster to fix problems. It's important to understand that sharing secrets can be very serious and affect many people.
